content.question: A curve is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, cosine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, sine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the sine squared of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the sine squared of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the sine cubed of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the sine cubed of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the sine cubed of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
